Detailed Description

Represents a template abstraction in the POM of a page.

Definition at line 57 of file Template.php.

POMTemplate::POMTemplate ( $  text  ) 

Constructs a new template. In order to createa a new empty template, one should:
*call the constructor with a string, e.g. $template = new POMTemplate('{{TEMPLATENAME}}');
*and then start adding parameters with $template->setParameter("NAME", "TEXTVALUE");

Parameters:
string $text The original text of the element.
Returns:
POMTemplate

Definition at line 31 of file Template.php.

References POMElement::$elementCounter, and POMTemplateParameter::parse().

Here is the call graph for this function:

POMTemplate::setParameter ( $  name,
$  value,
$  ignore_name_spacing = true,
$  ignore_value_spacing = true,
$  override_name_spacing = false,
#when original value exists $  override_value_spacing = false # when original value exists 
)

Set a parameter in the template. Used to update parameters or to create new ones. PLEASE NOTE: this function expect the value to be a string. Please check the documentation of the POMTemplateParameter class in order to see how to modify parameter values directly. Using this function will OVERWRITE the existing POMPage object created for the parameter value.

Parameters:
string $name The parameter name.
string $value The parameter value.
boolean $ignore_name_spacing
boolean $ignore_value_spacing
boolean $override_name_spacing
boolean $override_value_spacing
